page.title: 09ABERTHIN VILLAGE_LIFESTYLE
page.content: There are 31 houses in Aberthin, and although there are no shops, there are two pubs. 15 people attend churches in Cowbridge regulary. Most people like the country area, but complain about the lack of amenities. The most popular entertainment is the cinema, and most people enjoy visiting the local pubs. Almost all the villagers have pets, cats being most popular. 17 people have 2 cars and as most work in Cardiff or Bridgend, Aberthin can therefore be seen as a commuting village. The (B.4270) runs directly through Aberthin, and this provides easy access to nearby towns. Almost all children attend schools in Cowbridge, car again being the main form of transport. Most children attend youth organisations, eg.scouts, and most adults do not object strongly to blood sports, eg. hunting.
